page.title: 09LOCAL NEWS FROM DURHAM
page.content: In the first week in July{Dame Margot {Fonteyn,}Chancellor of the University, presented degrees,and opened a "Town & Gown" exhibition. 2000 children attended the annual{Church Schools' {Service}in the Cathedral. Venture Scouts were presented with {Queen's Scout Awards},and the Guides' flame of friendship arrived for their 75th. birthday.A new TA band,the{Burma {Band,}commemorated the 300th anniversary of the DLI. { The City Council}plans for Tollhouse Rd.were turned down and negotiations with Pengap over development broke down.Restoration of Neptune's statue from the Market Place is progressing. A{CCPR}sports leaders'course was held at the 6th form centre.{Bow School}has a Centenary Garden Fete &{Choristers' {School}may benefit from ManuLife's annual Â£3000 choristers' scholarship.
